hotciv.framework

Interface City

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CityImpl

    public interface City
    Represents a city in the game. Responsibilities: 1) Knows its owner. 2) Knows its population size. This source code is from the book "Flexible, Reliable Software: Using Patterns and Agile Development" published 2010 by CRC Press. Author: Henrik B Christensen Computer Science Department Aarhus University This source code is provided WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY either expressed or implied. You may study, use, modify, and distribute it for non-commercial purposes. For any commercial use, see http://www.baerbak.com/

      Changes the focus of a city to the specified value

    • Method Detail

      • getOwner

        Player getOwner()
        return the owner of this city.
        Returns:
        the player that controls this city.

      • getSize

        int getSize()
        return the size of the population.
        Returns:
        population size.

      • getProduction

        java.lang.String getProduction()
        return the type of unit this city is currently producing.
        Returns:
        a string type defining the unit under production, see GameConstants for valid values.

      • getWorkforceFocus

        java.lang.String getWorkforceFocus()
        return the work force's focus in this city.
        Returns:
        a string type defining the focus, see GameConstants for valid return values.

      • getTotalProduction

        int getTotalProduction()
        Getter for the current total production of the calling city
        Returns:
        int representing the current production of the city

      • increaseTotalProduction

        void increaseTotalProduction()
        Increase total production for a city this increase is maintained by the city variant

      • canProduceUnit

        boolean canProduceUnit()
        Condition check for the calling city's ability to produce a unit
        Returns:
        True if the calling city can produce a unit

      • changeProduction

        void changeProduction(java.lang.String production)
        Changes the calling city's current unit production focus
        Parameters:
        production - a unit to change focus of unit to be produced

      • changeFocus

        void changeFocus(java.lang.String focus)
        Changes the focus of a city to the specified value
        Parameters:
        focus - a string representing the new focus of the city

      • setOwner

        void setOwner(Player player)
        Sets the owner of the calling city
        Parameters:
        player - the new owner of the calling city
